text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Hosni Mubarak receives an urgent telephone call from Isreali Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and reconfirms the necessity of closing Jerusalem's tunnel. Mubarak, aiming at containing the situation, called Palestinian President Yasser Arafat, German Chancellor Helmut Kohl and French President Jacques Chirac.
- An Egypian police officer was wounded in Israeli-Palestinian clashes in Rafah.
- Search continues to recover 45 bodies after a ferry capsized in the Nile off a southern Egyptian village.
- Sixty people returned from a funeral in the southern province of Minya to drown in the Nile.
- A sad Friday night in Minya: 16 bodies were recovered and divers are looking for 34 more. Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri ordered urgent aid to be distributed to victims' families.
